posts.content:
Slicing Through Enemies while Humming a Tune PvM 1-40, PvP.

Medieval Mercenary (Double Weapon Master)--Fighter(14), Weapon Master(25), Bard(1)
By Deborah “Tyr” Templar

When a musician goes off to Knight School to add blade mastery to his/her talent list, it begs the question: is the song more powerful than the sword?
Author’s Note--Build Revision and History:
Medieval Mercenary (Double Weapon Master) dates back to my “Fighting Bard” Series, 2004/5, being one of my very first character series in the ECB1, consisting of different Bard/WM combinations in order to answer that age old question: which is mightier—the Pen(Song) or the Sword?

This character—as are all others in the series, which are being re-visited in light of 1.69 patch—is based on the Arthurian Tales and old Celtic lore (the “fighting bard”). This Bard-at-arms is a melee warrior, a “Crit Crazy” WM in fact with not just one but two weapon specializations, thus preferring not the Pen (Song) but the Sword. To see the original, with links therein to other characters in the “Fighting Bard” Series along with other build combos utilizing the FTR/WM/Bard Class in the ECB1 at the time of original posting, see: http://home.comcast.net/~worldofgreyhaw ... 50991.html
Pros and Cons:
The Medieval Mercenary enjoys a double weapon mastery, enabling among other things the delivery of different damage types, with high/PG AB 52+1 Song: 53 (78 AB Bio-Cap) to deliver what is nothing short of exceptional damage output -- slicing through enemies like there’s no tomorrow.

In order to achieve “Combat/Level 40 Excellence” some things had to be sacrificed, but defense wasn’t one of them—i.e., has a nice enough AC for a melee warrior (with Expertise for more), bolstered by IKD, and over 450HPs, such that defense is rather solid. Skills on the other hand are rather thin (but has what s/he really needs), and while saves could be better, has more than enough strength for carting i.e. clarity potions (typical melee!). Without any further ado, please meet:

Medieval Mercenary, Bard-at-Arms (Double Weapon Master)--Fighter(14), WM (25), Bard(1)

*Weapon NOTE:
Scimitar (medium weapon, slashing damage with excellent crit. range, particularly in the hands of a WM with a /x3 multiplier), and Heavy Flail (large weapon, bludgeoning damage with a good crit range in the hands of a WM and /x3 multiplier) selected for the ability to deliver different damage types, the Heavy Flail being quite deadly (with its 1.5 STR damage factor) while the scimmy makes fast work of non-crit immune enemies and allows for the use of Tower Shield (AC). That said, weapons are a matter of personal choice and if looking for a “period correct” (Medieval Knight) weapon, might I recommend a polearm? The closest in NWN being the Halberd, with damage stats set out in Combat section, below.
ALTERNATE OPTIONS:
Want a more skilled Blade? (PvP Optimization recommendation Included):
Adjustments: STR: 17 (32), DEX: 13, CON: 14, WIS: 8, INT: 14, CHA: 8
+1 Fort, +40HPs (496HPs) and +43 Skills [217 points, full-train Taunt (+6 AB) or Spellcraft (Bonus, +9 saves v. spells)], picking up Epic Fort (another +4 Fort, or 26 adj (35 v spells) or Armor Skin (+2 AC) in epic as opposed to what would be an extraneous STR. If looking to PvP your Mercenary, then consider the above stat adj. (picking up Epic Fort), and also swapping PA, IKD, WS/EWS Heavy Flail to pick up grt.fort (28 adj/37 v spells), disarm/impr.disarm, and ESF: Disc. (+10 Disc., or impr.unarmed strike) for PvP as follows:

06: Fighter(6): Weapon Focus: Heavy Flail, spring attack
08: Fighter(8): STR+1, improved critical: scimitar, (STR=19)
12: Weapon Master(2): STR+1, improved critical: heavy flail, (STR=20)
15: Weapon Master(5): great fort (or, improved knockdown)
18: Fighter(11): disarm
19: Fighter(12): improved disarm
21: Weapon Master(8): Epic Fortitude
33: Fighter(14): Epic Skill Focus: Discipline, epic weapon specialization: scimitar

Cost -2 STR (-1AB/damage, for an all-natural high/PG AB 52 (51+1 Song adj) still, and loss of WS/EWS on your Heavy Flail which WS/EWS on your secondary weapon along with IKD is quite enjoyable PvM/E, but not so much PvP where you’ll enjoy that boost to Fort, Disc. and disarm ability instead. [Note: skill check v opponent’s AB/attack to resist KD/IKD, Called Shots and Disarm, meantime reaching out with your large weapon (size boni, which also enhances your AB/attack roll, too) to disarm your foes instead, while enjoying all that 1.5x STR boni on your 2-hander, with WS/EWS also and still on your crit.charged scimmy, too; heh, best defense is a strong offense always (Enjoy!)].

*Prefer Early UMD/Magic Access—i.e. Versatility (PvM/E)? Alright. Here you go:
Drop 3 WM for 2 more FTR and 1 more Bard (i.e., FTR 16, Bard 2, WM 22). Run pre-ep as is, taking your first Bard at Lvl 23 (for a skills dump), other Bard at 40 as is. From Lvl. 24 on, run with WM (i.e., WM 10-21, and feats accordingly), grabbing your FTR 14 at Lvl. 36 (for EWS Scimitar/EWS Heavy Flail) followed by WM 22 at Lvl. 37 (epic prowess in turn), with 2 more FTRs thereafter (selecting Epic Toughess as a FTR bonus feat) and finish thus with your 2nd Bard [skills dump, with final distribution as follows: Disc 43(55), Intim 4(3), Listen 42(41), Perf 7(6), Tumble 40(41), UMD 36(35)]. Cost: -1 AB/damage, -4HPs, but +2skills and early magic access/added versatility. Your choice, your Medieval Mercenary, Double Weapon Master. Enjoy!
----

Sing, Slash, Crit ON! ~ Tyr

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content: All that is needed to cast Level 9 spells from scrolls with 100% success is a modified UMD 33 (or 34 ranks with CHA 8). If you drop Listen by 2 and use the 2 from UMD, a Spellcraft dump of those 4 points @Bard 1 will net +1 saves vs. spells in a build that is already save-starved.
